intro: Parosela fremontii var. californica, commonly known as the California parosela, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It produces small, oval fruits that are often used in traditional herbal medicine. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
